cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 173 (Thursday, November 21, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. VELAZQUEZ:H.R. 10247.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:The Congress shall have Power . . . To regulate Commercewith Foreign Nations, and among the several States, and withIndian Tribes.The single subject of this legislation is:The bill requires the SBA Administrator to make changes tothe SBA's Office of Credit Risk Management.[Page H6193]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

bill.title: 504 Credit Risk Management Improvement Act of 2024

item.title: 504 Credit Risk Management Improvement Act of 2024
504 Credit Risk Management Improvement Act of 2024

To amend the Small Business Act to enhance the Office of Credit Risk Management, to require the Administrator of the Small Business Administration to issue rules relating to environmental obligations of certified development companies, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
